Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2013 04:14PM Calameda wrote: Hello, New here.  Just met w/oncologist yesterday who is recommending chemo, then radiation.  I have limited health insurance and even less available time to take off work, so I may just go with radiation.  Definately a delayed diagnosis for me.  Lump visible on mammogram 6 months ago; I was told it was benign. At 6-month follow up, it had doubled in size and now is deemed agressive.  Just wondering if anyone knows of medical malpractice attorney (I'm in northern California) who might talk to me about this.  Not looking for financial windfall, just enough to afford costs of treatment and likely loss of income (which will lead to loss of my home I'm afraid).
Posts.Title: Mammogram/Radiologist did not see cancer - anyone else? Del5 Calameda
